Package net.ucanaccess.exception

Class UcanaccessSQLException

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Throwable
java.lang.Exception
java.sql.SQLException
net.ucanaccess.exception.UcanaccessSQLException
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Iterable<Throwable>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AuthenticationException, InvalidCreateStatementException, InvalidFunctionParameterException, InvalidIntervalValueException, InvalidParameterException, TableNotFoundException, UnsupportedTypeException
public class UcanaccessSQLException extends SQLException
The sql exception specific to Ucanaccess.

    • wrap

      public static final <T extends Throwable> UcanaccessSQLException wrap(T _t)
      Wraps a Throwable into a UcanaccessSQLException.

      If the throwable is already a UcanaccessSQLException, it's returned as is. This is a convenience method calling wrap(String, Throwable) without a reason prefix.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the Throwable to wrap.
      Parameters:
      _t - the Throwable to wrap.
      Returns:
      a UcanaccessSQLException instance.

    • wrap

      public static final <T extends Throwable> UcanaccessSQLException wrap(String _reason, T _t)
      Wraps a Throwable into a UcanaccessSQLException, prepending an optional reason message.

      Preserves original SQLState, ErrorCode, and Cause when wrapping SQLException types. If _reason is null or blank, the message is derived solely from _t.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the Throwable to wrap
      Parameters:
      _reason - an optional custom message prefix
      _t - the Throwable to wrap
      Returns:
      a UcanaccessSQLException instance

    • throwIf

      public static final <T extends UcanaccessSQLException> void throwIf(BooleanSupplier _condition, Supplier<T> _exceptionSupplier) throws T
      Throws:
      T
